sn52.3:0.3: 3. On the Bank of the Sutanu
sn52.3:1.1: At one time Venerable Anuruddha was staying near Sāvatthī on the bank of the Sutanu.
sn52.3:1.2: Then several mendicants went up to Venerable Anuruddha, and exchanged greetings with him.
sn52.3:1.3: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, they sat down to one side, and said to him:
sn52.3:1.4: “What things has Venerable Anuruddha developed and cultivated to attain great direct knowledge?”
sn52.3:2.1: “Reverends, I attained great direct knowledge by developing and cultivating the four kinds of mindfulness meditation.
sn52.3:2.3: I meditate observing an aspect of the body—keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.
sn52.3:2.4: I meditate observing an aspect of feelings …
sn52.3:2.6: principles—keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.
sn52.3:2.7: I attained great direct knowledge by developing and cultivating these four kinds of mindfulness meditation.
sn52.3:2.8: And it was by developing and cultivating these four kinds of mindfulness meditation that I directly knew the lower realm as lower, the middle realm as middle, and the higher realm as higher.”
